hints.content:
The *heaviest* basket of peaches weighs $6\dfrac12$ kilograms.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2e646b0b0de1566ce866d5cb755822d43a306ac0)

The *second heaviest* basket of peaches weighs $5$ kilograms.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/df6c746c0e822dcd44d2869ada862021741822c2)

To determine the difference between the heaviest basket and the second heaviest basket, we subtract the two values.  

$6\dfrac12\text{ kg} - 5\text{ kg}$
The difference between the heaviest basket and the second heaviest basket is $1\dfrac12$ kilograms.

question.content:
The owner of a produce stand is selling baskets of peaches, priced by the kilogram.  She rounded each measurements to the nearest $\dfrac{1}{2}$ of a kilogram.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/b8e00fa62103a2d0fb9cd8b1c9b1633dab78ea77)

**How much heavier is the heaviest basket than the second heaviest basket?**
